page.title: 04SOCIAL LIFE OF VERNHAM DEAN
page.content: In a small rural community such as Vernham Dean, entertainment is largely of our own making. As a result the village has thriving activities for the youngest to the oldest. For the children there is a toddlers group,for girls a Brownie Pack. Out of school there is a lively Theatre Club, giving public performances for Christmas entertainment. The Women Institute meets once a month and has a large membership. Dances are held as fund raisers for many different causes, Friends of the School,Theatre Club. The Friends of the Church hold the Harvest Supper and meetings of general interest in the Village Hall which the centre of all activities. Bazaars and fetes are held to raise money to improve the amenities of the village.The Georgians cater for the Old Age Pensioners.
